aria-allowed-role-1.title: Uses ARIA roles on incompatible elements
aria-allowed-role-1.description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-role).

items.snippet: <label id="mw-sidebar-button" class="mw-checkbox-hack-button mw-ui-icon mw-ui-button mw-ui-quiet mw-ui-icon-eleâ€¦" for="mw-sidebar-checkbox" role="button" aria-controls="mw-panel" data-event-name="ui.sidebar" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role button is not allowed for given element

definition-list-2.title: `<dl>`'s do not contain only properly-ordered `<dt>` and `<dd>` groups, `<script>`, `<template>` or `<div>` elements.
definition-list-2.description: When definition lists are not properly marked up, screen readers may produce confusing or inaccurate output. [Learn how to structure definition lists correctly](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/definition-list).

items.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  When not empty, element does not have at least one <dt> element followed by at least one <dd> element

frame-title-3.title: `<frame>` or `<iframe>` elements do not have a title
frame-title-3.description: Screen reader users rely on frame titles to describe the contents of frames. [Learn more about frame titles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/frame-title).

items.snippet: <iframe id=":2.container" class="VIpgJd-ZVi9od-ORHb-OEVmcd skiptranslate" frameborder="0" src="#" style="visibility:visible">
items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has no title attribute
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

heading-order-4.title: Heading elements are not in a sequentially-descending order
heading-order-4.description: Properly ordered headings that do not skip levels convey the semantic structure of the page, making it easier to navigate and understand when using assistive technologies. [Learn more about heading order](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/heading-order).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Heading order invalid

target-size-5.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
target-size-5.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

items.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (52.1px by 16px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 23.8px instead of at least 24px.

  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 23.8px instead of at least 24px.
